Posts.Content: That was very nice. Thank you
Posts.Title: My Survivor's Poem Hope you enjoy Much Love

Posts.Content: Thanks for the info Chen. I thought last summer was bad with chemo. It's for me worse on Tamoxifen. My face turns red, like bright red. I look terrible. Like I have over heated and ready to blow. It is embarrassing as well. It last for a long time, not just a hot flash and it's gone. It's a pain in the ---. Anyone have any thoughts on this ?
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen and sun exposure

Posts.Content: Went to grandkids soccer game today, so first time for me in the sun since Tamoxifen, Turned red and itchy. Had sunscreen on, did not really burn just got red and itchy.
Posts.Title: Tamoxifen and sun exposure

Posts.Content: Hey Moopy, The man is willing to wait on you hand and foot. I am sure you have plenty of work when you do get home. Rest, enjoy the last days of your summer home. Take care of yourself. Your friend, Kathy PS - Tell your cheesehead, we will be in Green Lake for a week. Loving every minute of it.

Posts.Content: I think everyone is different in how the respond to the drugs. I was tired towards the end of treatment.

Posts.Content: Joan had good advice, that should work. I had problems eating certain foods so the doctor had me take meds for that. Oddly enough I could eat white castle, that did for me.

Posts.Content: I just had my 4th ac and I am just really tired. In 2 weeks I have heart scan and then taxol and herceptin.
Posts.Title: Anybody else get racy after a/c treatments

Posts.Content: You know the steps, you know what needs to be done and you will do it all. That's what you told me once except you pretty much had to tell me the steps LOL. Hanging in there with you. Holding your hand. Hugs Kathy
Posts.Title: Monday's Biopsy Results

Posts.Content: I don't think anyone here would look at it as you put it that your problem is worse than anyone else. Don't be afraid to post, thats what this site is for. We all have some crazy feelings that come out from time to time. Cancer the definition should be - Angry,emotional,scared.
Posts.Title: PLEASE forgive ME!

Posts.Content: Hope all goes well for you, will keep you in my prayers.
Posts.Title: Tomorrow's the "Day" (10--21-09)

Posts.Content: That's just terrible. You need to check the laws in your state. What I have heard around here (Illinois ) The income is based on the here and now, so if your not working he is ---- out of luck. Also, a judge will consider your medical issue's. No they won't look at it that your dying so give it all up, that's BS. Gosh this just makes me so mad, and I have a good man thank God. You go for it girl.
Posts.Title: metastatic breast cancer and SURVIVING AN ABUSIVE EX-HUSHAND

Posts.Content: When my hair was falling out we were in the car on the way to treatment and I was driving. The air was on in the car. All of a sudden we had hair flying all over the car. By the time i got to the hospital my car was full of hair strands. Looked like I had a long hair dog in the car and just as hard to clean up.
Posts.Title: should I go ahead and shave my head

Posts.Content: I was told to get the shot. My Onc made that very clear.
Posts.Title: To flu or not to flu

Posts.Content: Wow, some of you your hair is growing really fast. Mine is going slow and I was done the end of November. Well, I have hair but not as long as some of you. My eyelashs came in beautiful and now hardle have any again.
Posts.Title: should I go ahead and shave my head

Posts.Content: Not me for sure .... Railroad I get the rolling eyes. Pay attention to the road, don't drive to fast, be safe. God Bless. Kathy
Posts.Title: Thursday AM check-in

Posts.Content: My hair started falling out in clumps.14 days after the start of chemo. I had my son shave it off. It's hard to do, but its going to happen anyways so we just got it over with. Cried all day and then moved on.
Posts.Title: should I go ahead and shave my head

Posts.Content: Most of you know about Carter. He needs our circle of prayer. Carter was air lifted to Children Memorial this morning. He was having breathing problems. He has been put on a ventilator. Carter is a 6 year old boy with a brain tumor. He has been through a lot over the past year. Carter and his family needs our prayers today. Thanks
Posts.Title: Prayers for Carter

Posts.Content: What a wonderfull things to do.
Posts.Title: *****Bill**** This is for you*****B12

Posts.Content: You won't need to ask, you will know when it starts coming out. My hair had no shame, it blew out of my head with my cars air cond going. Blew all over the car and when i ran my finger through my hair it came out in chunks. This was like day 14 after the start of Ac chemo. Came home and had my son shave my head. Its a heart breaker, but we do get through it.
Posts.Title: Hair Loss Symptoms

Posts.Content: The words are nice to hear. I know how you feel. Even after 2 years here, every six months I have the same fear and stress going to the doctor. PTSD for sure. Hugs Kathy
Posts.Title: Six month visit with Med Onc

Posts.Content: So many of you have been a part of the prays and good thoughts for over a year now for 6 year old Carter. Early this morning Carter lost his battle with brain cancer. I need to ask this question. Did any of you ever feel like, you should not have survived your cancer. I am not sure I am explaining what I mean. I would have traded my life for a childs life, but thats not what I mean. Having problems putting it into words. I am very sorry to have posted this, but I know some of you would have wanted to know. Please continue to keep the family in your prayers. Thanks Kathy
Posts.Title: Sorry to post such bad news

Posts.Content: You said it well. We all get it.
Posts.Title: Because some things aren't suitable for Facebook...

Posts.Content: How funny, my friend Re here on this board said it's funny how we found humor in having Cancer and thats what has kept us going. Kathy
Posts.Title: short note on Hair...

Posts.Content: Everyone is different sometimes when it comes to chemo, but it looks like your doing pretty good. I also have to do herceptin. I will be finished with that in September. Herceptin does not have the side affects as chemo. It's just a drag to have to go all the time. I am doing my herceptin treatment every 3 weeks once I was done with chemo. The time went by faster then I thought it would. Hang in there. Hugs
Posts.Title: What do I expect after next treatments?

Posts.Content: My understanding with hospice is you must be terminal and about 6 months left to live. However my Mom lived 18 months and hospice did not leave us.

Posts.Content: On the bus !!!

Posts.Content: With you all the way.

Posts.Content: Hold on to your memories, and she will always be with you. You are in my thoughts and prayer. Kathy
Posts.Title: Tomorrow (tonight) is a bit tough....

Posts.Content: So very sorry for your loss. I know how hard it is. Hugs
Posts.Title: My Beautiful Angel died

Posts.Content: So very sorry for your loss. I know how hard it is. Hugs
Posts.Title: My Beautiful Angel died

Posts.Content: I think Mimi is right and it will give you something to do. All the young adults are on facebook. I know my kids are and they are close to the same age as you have mentioned. Send them all a message, tell them how you miss them. They might think you are just fine and don't need them. Another thing, maybe they just don't know what to say. Give it a try. If that does not work we can have another party with you and help you through it. Your home, check with your village/city. They may have some idea's for you to get some free help on fixing your home. Sometimes church's, the high school, community service have the help you may need. Good luck, let us know how it goes.
Posts.Title: Pity Party

Posts.Content: My husband and I have been very worried about a problem with his eyes for the last week. a Today we got some good news that all is ok. So we are very grateful for that. Kathy
Posts.Title: We need some really good news today!

Posts.Content: Prayers coming your way for sure.
Posts.Title: Benefit for a friend, need prayers

Posts.Content: Your doctor will explain more to you. The herceptin is because you are Her 2 pos. Herceptin is a good drug. It good we have that. I am also her2 pos and was given herceptin. I also had AC 4 rounds and 12 rounds of taxol, 35 rad treatments and 1 year of Herceptin. Herceptin was easy for me, I had no side affects. Good luck to you. Don't worry to much it's all doable.
Posts.Title: My Chemo Drugs??

Posts.Content: I don't have an answer for you, just glad you back posting.
Posts.Title: Flank pain....

Posts.Content: Sorry your feeling so bad. Day's like this will come and go, but we do get through them.
Posts.Title: Cried my eyes out tonight !!!!

Posts.Content: Yep, me to. Vision changed a lot.
Posts.Title: Taxol or perhaps A/C changed my eyesight!

Posts.Content: Same problem here. Eyes water looks like I am crying. No crust, just tears. Lost eyelashes to so this may be the problem. Was told that the chemo does this to.
Posts.Title: Chemo Chicks

Posts.Content: I hope she forgives you for telling everyone she was full of, well you know what. Glad to see you posting again. Please tell moopy to read her mail. Kathy
Posts.Title: Flank pain....

Posts.Content: I use Nutri Ox. It's like Nioxin, I bought it at Sally's. I don't think it cost's as much as Nioxin. I have used the conditiner from the beginning of hair growth. I started the shampoo when there was enough to wash. My hair came in thicker than I had before I lost it.It is straight, no curl yet, I have about 2 or more inches. Stuff, does not smell really good. Kinda like medicine, but it does not stay in your hair. Oh, one more thing I used the conditioner every night. Let us know how it goes.
Posts.Title: Has anyone tried Nioxin?

Posts.Content: Hi cvolk and welcome. I came to this site last April. I recieved a lot of help here. Help that I could not get anywhere else. My family and friends were wonderful, and you will find with some you wind up comforting them. So this site is the place to be. You will get honest answers to your questions. Some answers you may not want to here. I had a lumpectomy with 22 nodes removed 2 positive. I am her2 positive. I am currently doing chemo and then will do Rads. I learned from others here on this site to take it one day at a time. I learned that there is a lot of waiting for answers. I learned how to control my fear. I learned who my friends are. I learned how horrible everyone feels when our hair falls out. I also learned that it's all doable. You can do this, and you will have help every step of the way here with your new friends. Just except help from others there at home. Everyone heals different, so just do what you can when you can. Say No when you need to. Good luck, Hugs and prayers.
Posts.Title: Rookie could use some advice

Posts.Content: We do have a bond that know one can break. Hugs
Posts.Title: Do you want to know something sisters in pink?

Posts.Content: Ok I am on the bus, My prayers will be with you. Let us know how your doing when you feel up to it.

Posts.Content: We do have a bond that know one can break. Hugs

Posts.Content: I had the MRI, my experiance was the same as Noel. Just don't move or you will make the test longer. There was no music for me, but I just kept still. If your doctor can give you something to relax that might help. Having said all this it is doable. Good Luck

Posts.Content: OMG is right. I am with Christmas Girl, we only have the little garden snakes around here. I"m with you, I would have ran. Scared to death of snakes and thats the little ones. Remember the drinks we talked about, nows a good time for one.

I have never had this before.

Posts.Content: So very sorry, I can hardley type this for the tears running down my face. Lord knows you have been here for all of us. We will be here for you and Reggie. Just kick this cancer's ***. Lot's of love and hugs sent your way. Kathy

Posts.Title: Just when I thought it was safe to go back in the water, I was bitten by Jaws! So to speak...

Posts.Content: Hi, I have not experienced this with family, but I have with someone who claims to be a friend. A chidhood friend. I did not tell her I was diagnosed. Yesterday we were both at a Birthday party and another friend of mine blurts out about me being sick. So this friend who I did not tell starts to cry and leaves the room. So I was feeling terrible and I went to talk to her and she was crying on her boyfriens shoulder. I told her I did not mean for anyone to get hurt. Then her boyfriend who is also a friend of mine says to me " What the hell, this is the way we find out" and she is still crying. I said once again that I was sorry. Then I got to thinking, this was not about me this was about her. All the pointless drama. They never asked me, How I felt, what was nexted, how bad is it, nothing at all, but there upset I did not tell them. Now I know why I did not tell them. No you can't pick your family, but I am sure your sister really does care, it's that everyone is use to you being the caregiver. Kathy
Posts.Title: I am so dissapointed in my family

Posts.Content: Happy Birthday shortscake.

Posts.Content: Happy Birthday shortscake.
Posts.Title: When is Your Birthday?

Posts.Content: Hi. welcome. I don't know what you have heard about the treatment today. Its not at all like it was years ago. They have come a long way. I had chemo 16 rounds. Lost my hair also and about ready to do Rads. They have great meds out there to keep you from getting sick. For me it was doable. I was afraid if I did not do chemo and have all the follow ups that go with it, that I would die. For me I made the right decision. I don't have the greatest of Insurance. Don't let money make the decision for you. First you have to take care of yourself or whatever money you have saved, you won't be around to spend it. What ever decision you make, don't let it be about money. Do your homework on all counts. Good luck.
Posts.Title: Has anyone out there refused chemo?

Posts.Content: I am on Herceptin, only had 3 treatments so far. Will be on a year.

Posts.Content: No nausea here. I am on week 3 and feel fine.

Posts.Content: My prayers are with you and your family. Take care of yourself Jean. Hugs Kathy
Posts.Title: MIL Passed Away

Posts.Content: I had a lumpectomy last June and mine feel the same way. I also was told scar tissue. I was also told that the feel of the breast can change again. I have lumps and bumps. I asked how I would ever tell if I were to get another lump ( cancer ). My doctor told me to learn my new breast. So all I can tell you is this is normal. Don't be surprised if you feel pain every now and again. Just when in dought, ask your doctor.
Posts.Title: Feeling scared again!

Posts.Content: you went for your last treatment in a storm and I went for my 1st treatment in this storm. I am gonna have to do it again tomorrow, and the looks of it the storm is not going away anytime to the soon. Its 45 min to the hospital on a good day.
Posts.Title: Going for next to last treatment for radiation in a snow storm.Am I nuts(probley).

Posts.Content: Oh, I hear ya. We just moved in January here. I get the hoarder. I don't know were we got all the stuff. All I can say is Goodwill. Husband took the stuff out the door before I could change my mind. It's hard work for sure. Kathy ~

Posts.Content: I am available most of the time. That was fun, even though I could not keep up.
Posts.Title: Chat Room = Fast Typers! lol

Posts.Content: Betsy I am sorry you are feeling so down and out, We are here for you. Hope we can find something in your area so you can have more of a one on one. Hugs Kathy ~
Posts.Title: still can't find a support group

Posts.Content: I have no idea whats going on with me. I could cry at the drop of a hat. Now I have felt like this before at the very beginning of this journey, but now I am close to the end of treatment, besides herceptin until next summer. I started taking Tamoxifen, is this making me feel like this? I am on all the good drugs for the depression and all that goes with it. Why now do I feel like I am falling back. Is this normal ? Yes, I have a lot going on in my life right now and it's not all about me, but I was feeling this way before. I can't seem to get it together the last 2 weeks or so. Can't sleep through the night. I have drugs for that to. So tell me whats going on ? Why now ? Could not be a worse time right now to be this way.
Posts.Title: Cry

Posts.Content: I was told the breast MRI shows everything, better than anything else they have. Now I am pretty new to this so I could be wrong on my information,and I have been filled with a lot lately. This is what I think my surgeon told me.

Posts.Content: Well of course your looking for a lobster recipe, you live in Maine. Here we have very expensive frozen lobster and if you want fresh you have to take out a loan. Enjoy
Posts.Title: Need recipe for lobster and clams

Posts.Content: Judy is right the waiting is the hardest, but you can not go into surgery sick. I was Dx in April and I did not have surgery until June ( lumpectomy ). I had both IDC and DCIS. You have got to trust in your doctors. It is good to pay attention to what they are doing for you, but at the same time you have to believe you are getting the best treatment possible. Having said that, this is what will help you get through. Hang in there, Hugs
Posts.Title: Seeing the surgeon again tomorrow

Posts.Content: I just finished AC chemo. You wrote AC-T I don't know what that means. If it's Taxol then I am going into that in 2 weeks for 12 treatments. With the Ac, I would start to feel sick about day 3 after treatment. Make sure you take all the meds for nausea. It was doable.
Posts.Title: found out what kind of chemo i will be doing

Posts.Content: AC was tuff on me to. I was sick for about three days after treatment. I had Taxol, it was easier. Just felt sick once in a while, but I was tired. Hang in there, your almost done.
Posts.Title: ughh Chemo #5 and I'm sick!

Posts.Content: Reality does set in when you begin treatment. I hope it all goes well for you. It's good you found this board, it will help you get through.
Posts.Title: First Chemo today

Posts.Content: Your so right susan. Once you hear that horrible word Cancer, and there talking about you and you realize your wide awake and not having a nightmare,life as you new it changed in a heart beat. I hang on tight to my friends here, they have seen me though some tuff moments.I am positive regarding my DX and I am not to sure I would be, had it not been for all the wonderful support I found here. Thats not to say I don't relapse every now and again.
